data.title: How to install extensions inside a WinRM/RS session?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 2012 R2

I want to automate the installation of vscode inside a vagrant managed environment. Vagrant uses WinRM to execute commands inside the Windows VM. For some reason I cannot install extensions like I can do when running the same command at a normal Command Prompt.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install a Windows vagrant environment (you could use https://github.com/rgl/choco-0.9.10.3-not-working-with-vagrant/blob/master/Vagrantfile) or just setup WinRM on your machine.
2. try to install an extension with `winrs -r:localhost -u:vagrant -p:vagrant code --install-extension ms-vscode.PowerShell`.
3. and list the installed `winrs -r:localhost -u:vagrant -p:vagrant code --list-extensions`
4. realize that nothing was installed. in fact, `code` does not even produce any output.

Any idea on how to get this working?

data.title: typescriptServiceClient using up cpu on mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.4.0
- OS Version: 10.11.1 (OS X El Capitan)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open up the editor (all third-party extensions are disabled).
2. And simply open files and navigate.

![screen shot 2016-08-20 at 2 02 07 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1330851/17830092/24020326-66df-11e6-81ce-f7cee9b9a349.png)

Closing the higher cpu using `Code Helper` process gives the following log:-

```
[Extension Host] Error: Service died.
    at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptServiceClient.js:236:46
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at TypeScriptServiceClient.serviceExited (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptServiceClient.js:235:37)
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptServiceClient.js:176:31)
    at emitTwo (events.js:105:20)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:185:7)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:204:12)
```

Haven't had the chance to debug the issue in depth. But `typescriptServiceClient` seems to be responsible for the cause. 

Hope this helps. Love VSCode.

data.title: Question about sort menu items
Feature Request: HAML Live Resolution after Enter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 - OS Version: Windows 10 64bit Steps: Type in `.container#content` in a HTML File and press Enter Actual behaviour: Nothing happens Expected behaviour: VSCode will replace this line(tab intended) with `
[cursor here]
` That will be useful and I can type way more faster. It's more easier.

data.title: PowerShell on Mac OS X: Intellisense not working for cmdlets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:41:29.513Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add PowerShell extension,
2. Open a PowerShell script, 
3. Type Get-P and press Ctrl-space - expected outcome is to see Get-Process - instead shows No Suggestions.

data.title: PowerShell on Mac OS X: error Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:41:29.513Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Added PowerShell extension,
2. Created a simple file hello.ps1 with simple script: $i = 1,
3. Save the file,
4. Open folder containing the file,
5. Click Debug,
6. Accept default launch.json:

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "PowerShell",
            "type": "PowerShell",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${file}",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${file}"
        }
    ]
}
```
1. Press F5.
2. Shows error "Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly"

data.body:

- OS Version: Windows 10

-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

Add functionality similar to QuickEdit the Adobe Brackets for quick edits CSS file, or when I have a `style` tag in my HTML.

Simple explanation how it works: https://www.granneman.com/webdev/editors/brackets/quick-edit/

Add the functionality of this [extension](https://github.com/angular-ui/AngularJS-brackets) is the same as the QuickEdit but for directives, controllers and services on AngularJS in my JS or when one has a `script` tag in my HTML.

That would be a similar function with the [Peek](http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved#_peek) VSCode and [File Peek](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=abierbaum.vscode-file-peek) extension, but for HTML.

data.title: change the debugger controls from a floating toolbar to a more in-line one?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.4.0 - OS Version: MacOS I find that the floating debugger controls - while not taking up much space - can obscure tabs that I'm sometimes interested in seeing. I think moving the debugger controls to be in-line with the find controls would make the UI work a bit better. If the debugger controls were in-line with the find (and the replace) controls, they would only obscure parts of the first few lines of a file instead of parts of the editor tabs. I think this would be an improvement. That in-line control could re-size as necessary to hold the debug panel, the find panel, and the replace panel.

data.title: RenameProvider should be able to signal whether a location is valid for a rename
data.body:
Currently a RenameProvider can be instructed to make renames that are not valid, eg.:

``` dart
import "dart:html";
```

Here, you can rename on the `import` which makes no sense. While it's possible for us to return no edits, it's weird to give the user a textbox pre-populated with `import`.

It would be better if a RenameProvider can be queried to see whether a rename is valid for a given location and Code can then avoid showing the rename box entirely.

data.title: Javascript Intellisense
VSCode.ShipIt Service could not initialize xpcproxy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.5

Every two seconds I'm receiving these in the system Console:

```
8/19/16 12:30:55.476 PM com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.microsoft.VSCode.ShipIt[18008]) Service could not initialize: 15F34: xpcproxy + 12684 [1462][F7717708-ACF7-307D-B04E-998DFC36598F]: 0xd
8/19/16 12:30:55.476 PM com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.microsoft.VSCode.ShipIt) Service only ran for 0 seconds. Pushing respawn out by 2 seconds.
```

I assume this isn't normal that xpcproxy is crashing. I'm fairly new to vscode so I haven't noticed any particular feature not working except I cannot update vscode without manually going to the website and getting a new binary, but it sounds like #3520 is the cause of that.

data.title: Class function coloring fails if type sequelize.Model<{}, {}>; is used
ParameterInformation isn't rendered when only contains a label

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

The docs for [`ParameterInformation`](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#ParameterInformation) make it seem like `documentation` is optional (I hope so, Dart doesn't have any):

``` typescript
new ParameterInformation(label: string, documentation?: string): ParameterInformation
```

However if you don't provide any, the parameter info doesn't seem to be rendered:

``` typescript
let sigInfo = new SignatureInformation("SIG INFO");
sigInfo.parameters = [new ParameterInformation("PARAM INFO")];
```

![Missing parameter info](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/17814172/661545fc-6626-11e6-8b2d-a8ef1adc33a4.png)

``` typescript
let sigInfo = new SignatureInformation("SIG INFO");
sigInfo.parameters = [new ParameterInformation("PARAM INFO")];
sigInfo.parameters[0].documentation = "test";
```

![Included parameter info](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/17814175/69831390-6626-11e6-8be2-e0232e35a7a5.png)

data.title: First NumPad+Enter does not produce new line when switching from diff to normal editor
data.body:
I have this issue since a couple of months and only now realized how to reproduce. So I do not think it is related to the keybinding service context change we did:
- open a diff from the git viewlet and copy a line from the right hand side
- use quick open to jump back to another editor that is not a diff
- press Enter
  => you do not get a new line

data.title: editor.action.smartSelect.grow action on empty tab throws warning
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 (1.4.0) and latest master.
- OS Version: El Captain - 10.11.6 (15G31)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new empty tab.
2. Trigger `editor.action.smartSelect.grow` or `editor.action.smartSelect.shrink` action using the keyboard shortcut.

The following warning crops up.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1949807/17813516/45d0e2ba-6649-11e6-8948-65712f4ec9d3.png)

Expected: Either a meaningful warning (is that necessary?). Or no warning at all.

data.title: Feature Request: Customisation Bundles

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Support switching between preset customisations of
- extensions
- layout
- workspace settings
- custom buttons (#10709)

**why?** 
for one, it would allow all front-end developers to make an opinionated IDE for development of their platform.

data.title: Feature Request: Customisable Buttons
data.body:
Support adding custom buttons that execute a terminal command. 
Support custom button context options (states that need to be true to be enabled). 
Support downloading icons for said custom button from Noun Project.

data.title: load keybindings.json from .vscode dir if there is any ?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Latest

Not sure wheter it's a good idea, however for me it would make sense to put the keybindings.json into the .vscode dir, so all devs get the same keybindings on the project.

maybe it should load it from .vscode (if a dir is openend), then from the user location (and overwrite if conflicting). or is it already possible to define keybindings in the .vscode dir (didn't work as i just put the keybindings.json into it)?

data.title: VS Code hangs and couldn't even be terminated. Needed to reboot my machine

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5 insider
- OS Version:

No steps. Here is what I could capture: 
- I exited VS Code but two processes stayed around
  `"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\Code - Insiders.exe"`
  `"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\Code - Insiders.exe" --reporter-url=https://ticinocrashreporter.azurewebsites.net/crash --application-name=VSCode --v=1`
- trying to kill one of them reported on the first one:
  ![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/17808798/79666cb2-6612-11e6-9ba6-b461f120f8cf.png)
- starting code again didn't work since it tried to reuse these two process. The start simply hung.
